attributes.additional_details:
You can buy a packet of biscuits in any Tesco supermarket in the country and you will pay same price regardless of where you are.

Why can't you do this with petrol, every station has a different price. The petrol prices across the country should be the same regardless of where you are for each company. For example, there are 4 BP stations on my way to work, a 22 mile journey, and the prices are all different.

Don't you agree this is wrong and the prices should be the same?
